briefdescription.para: Whether a subexpression needs to evaluated for all atoms.

detaileddescription.para: This flag is set for SEL_SUBEXPR elements that are used to evaluate non-atom-valued selection method parameters, as well as those that are used directly as values of selections.

briefdescription.para: Whether the whole subexpression should be treated as static.

detaileddescription.para: This flag is always false if SEL_DYNAMIC is set for the element, but it is also false for static elements within common subexpressions.

briefdescription.para: Whether the subexpression will always be evaluated in the same group.
Whether the compiler evaluation routine should return the maximal selection.
Whether memory has been allocated for gmin and gmax.
Whether to update gmin and gmax in static analysis.
Whether the subexpression uses simple pass evaluation functions.
Whether a static subexpression needs to support multiple evaluations.

detaileddescription.para: This flag may only be set on SEL_SUBEXPR elements that also have SEL_CDATA_SIMPLESUBEXPR.

briefdescription.para: Whether this expression is a part of a common subexpression.
Compiler flags.
Internal data structure used by the compiler.
Helper method for printing out debug information about a min/max group.
Prints a human-readable version of the internal compiler data structure.

parameterdescription.para: File handle to receive the output.

briefdescription.para: Allocates memory for storing the evaluated value of a selection element.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Selection element to initialize
isize
Maximum evaluation group size.
bChildEval
true if children have already been processed.
If called more than once, memory is (re)allocated to ensure that the maximum of the isize values can be stored.
Allocation of POS_VALUE selection elements is a special case, and is handled by alloc_selection_pos_data().

briefdescription.para: Allocates memory for storing the evaluated value of a selection element.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Selection element to initialize.
Allocation of POS_VALUE selection elements is a special case, and is handled by this function instead of by alloc_selection_data().

briefdescription.para: Replace the evaluation function of each element in the subtree.

parameterdescription.para: Root of the selection subtree to process.

memberdef.argsstring: (SelectionTreeElement *root, const char *spost, const char *rpost, const gmx::internal::SelectionData *sel)
memberdef.name: init_pos_keyword_defaults

briefdescription.para: Initializes default values for position keyword evaluation.

parameterdescription.para: Root of the element tree to initialize.
Selection that the element evaluates the positions for, or NULL if the element is an internal element.

briefdescription.para: Reverses the chain of selection elements starting at root.

parameterdescription.para: First selection in the whole selection chain.

simplesect.para: The new first element for the chain.

briefdescription.para: Removes subexpressions that don't have any references.

detaileddescription.para:
root
First selection in the whole selection chain.
The new first element for the chain. The elements are processed in reverse order to correctly detect subexpressions only referred to by other subexpressions.

briefdescription.para: Creates a name with a running number for a subexpression.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
The subexpression to be named.
i
Running number for the subexpression.
The name of the selection becomes "SubExpr N", where N is i; Memory is allocated for the name and the name is stored both as the name of the subexpression element and as gmx::SelectionTreeElement::u::cgrp::name; the latter is freed by _gmx_selelem_free().

briefdescription.para: Processes and extracts subexpressions from a given selection subtree.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Root of the subtree to process.
subexprn
Pointer to a subexpression counter.
Pointer to a chain of subselections, or NULL if none were found. This function finds recursively all SEL_SUBEXPRREF elements below the given root element and ensures that their children are within SEL_SUBEXPR elements. It also creates a chain of SEL_ROOT elements that contain the subexpression as their children and returns the first of these root elements.

briefdescription.para: Extracts subexpressions of the selection chain.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
First selection in the whole selection chain.
The new first element for the chain. Finds all the subexpressions (and their subexpressions) in the selection chain starting from sel and creates SEL_SUBEXPR elements for them. SEL_ROOT elements are also created for each subexpression and inserted into the selection chain before the expressions that refer to them.

briefdescription.para: Removes redundant boolean selection elements.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Root of the selection subtree to optimize.
This function merges similar boolean operations (e.g., (A or B) or C becomes a single OR operation with three operands).

briefdescription.para: Reorders children of boolean expressions such that static selections come first.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Root of the selection subtree to reorder.
The relative order of static expressions does not change. The same is true for the dynamic expressions.

briefdescription.para: Processes arithmetic expressions to simplify and speed up evaluation.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Root of the selection subtree to process.
Currently, this function only converts integer constants to reals within arithmetic expressions.

briefdescription.para: Sets the evaluation functions for the selection (sub)tree.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Root of the selection subtree to process.
This function sets the evaluation function (gmx::SelectionTreeElement::evaluate) for the selection elements.

briefdescription.para: Sets the memory pool for selection elements that can use it.

parameterdescription.para: Root of the selection subtree to process.

briefdescription.para: Prepares the selection (sub)tree for evaluation.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Root of the selection subtree to prepare.
It also allocates memory for the sel->v.u.g or sel->v.u.p structure if required.

briefdescription.para: Allocates memory for the compiler data and initializes the structure.

parameterdescription.para: Root of the selection subtree to process.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the static evaluation flag for a selection subtree.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Root of the selection subtree to process.
Sets the bStaticEval in the compiler data structure: for any element for which the evaluation group may depend on the trajectory frame, the flag is cleared.
reorder_boolean_static_children() should have been called.

briefdescription.para: Compute reference counts for subexpressions.

parameterdescription.para: Root of the selection subtree to process.

briefdescription.para: Initializes compiler flags for subexpressions.

parameterdescription.para: Root of the selection subtree to process.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the gmin and gmax fields of the compiler data structure.

parameterdescription.para: Root of the selection subtree to process.

briefdescription.para: Initializes evaluation groups for root items.

detaileddescription.para:
sc
Selection collection data.
The evaluation group of each SEL_ROOT element corresponding to a selection in sc is set to NULL. The evaluation group for SEL_ROOT elements corresponding to subexpressions that need full evaluation is set to sc->gall.

briefdescription.para: Marks a subtree completely dynamic or undoes such a change.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Selection subtree to mark.
bDynamic
If true, the bStatic flag of the whole selection subtree is cleared. If false, the flag is restored to using SEL_DYNAMIC.
Does not descend into parameters of methods unless the parameters are evaluated for each atom.

briefdescription.para: Frees memory for subexpressions that are no longer needed.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Selection subtree to check.
Checks whether the subtree rooted at sel refers to any SEL_SUBEXPR elements that are not referred to by anything else except their own root element. If such elements are found, all memory allocated for them is freed except the actual element. The element is left because otherwise a dangling pointer would be left at the root element, which is not traversed by this function. Later compilation passes remove the stub elements.

briefdescription.para: Makes an evaluated selection element static.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Selection element to make static.
The evaluated value becomes the value of the static element. The element type is changed to SEL_CONST and the children are deleted.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates a constant expression during analyze_static().

simplesect.para: 0 on success, a non-zero error code on error.

briefdescription.para: Sets the parameter value pointer for SEL_SUBEXPRREF params.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Selection to process.
Copies the value pointer of sel to sel->u.param if one is present and should receive the value from the compiler (most parameter values are handled during parsing). If sel is not of type SEL_SUBEXPRREF, or if sel->u.param is NULL, the function does nothing. Also, if the sel->u.param does not have SPAR_VARNUM or SPAR_ATOMVAL, the function returns immediately.

briefdescription.para: Handles the initialization of a selection method during analyze_static() pass.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Selection element to process.
top
Topology structure.
isize
Size of the evaluation group for the element.
0 on success, a non-zero error code on return. Calls sel_initfunc() (and possibly sel_outinitfunc()) to initialize the method. If no SPAR_ATOMVAL parameters are present, multiple initialization is prevented by using SEL_METHODINIT and SEL_OUTINIT flags.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the static part of a boolean expression.

detaileddescription.para:
data
Evaluation data.
sel
Boolean selection element whose children should be processed.
g
The evaluation group.
0 on success, a non-zero error code on error. reorder_item_static_children() should have been called.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the minimum and maximum groups for a boolean expression.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
SEL_BOOLEAN element currently being evaluated.
g
Group for which sel has been evaluated.
gmin
Largest subset of the possible values of sel.
gmax
Smallest superset of the possible values of sel.
This is a helper function for analyze_static() that is called for dynamic SEL_BOOLEAN elements after they have been evaluated. It uses the minimum and maximum groups of the children to calculate the minimum and maximum groups for sel, and also updates the static part of sel (which is in the first child) if the children give cause for this.

This function may allocate some extra memory for gmin and gmax, but as these groups are freed at the end of analyze_static() (which is reached shortly after this function returns), this should not be a major problem.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the static parts of sel and analyzes the structure.

detaileddescription.para:
data
Evaluation data.
sel
Selection currently being evaluated.
g
Group for which sel should be evaluated.
0 on success, a non-zero error code on error. This function is used as the replacement for the gmx::SelectionTreeElement::evaluate function pointer. It does the single most complex task in the compiler: after all elements have been processed, the gmin and gmax fields of t_compiler_data have been properly initialized, enough memory has been allocated for storing the value of each expression, and the static parts of the expressions have been evaluated. The above is exactly true only for elements other than subexpressions: another pass is required for subexpressions that are referred to more than once and whose evaluation group is not known in advance.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the evaluation group for a SEL_ROOT element.

detaileddescription.para:
root
Root element to initialize.
gall
Group of all atoms.
Checks whether it is necessary to evaluate anything through the root element, and either clears the evaluation function or initializes the evaluation group.

briefdescription.para: Finds the highest atom index required to evaluate a selection subtree.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Root of the selection subtree to process.
requiredAtoms
The atoms required to evaluate the subtree. The existing group is only added to, so multiple calls with the same parameter will compute the union over several subtrees.
For evaluation that starts from a SEL_ROOT element with a fixed group, children will never extend the evaluation group except for method parameter evaluation (which have their own root element), so it is sufficient to check the root. However, children of SEL_EXPRESSION elements (i.e., the method parameters) may have been independently evaluated to a static group that no longer has a separate root, so those need to be checked as well.
Position calculations are not considered here, but are analyzed through the position calculation collection in the main compilation method.

briefdescription.para: Optimizes subexpression evaluation.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Root of the selection subtree to process.
Optimizes away some unnecessary evaluation of subexpressions that are only referenced once.

memberdef.argsstring: (const SelectionTreeElementPointer &sel, gmx::PositionCalculationCollection *pcc, e_poscalc_t type, int flags)
memberdef.name: init_item_comg

briefdescription.para: Initializes COM/COG calculation for method expressions that require it.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Selection subtree to process.
pcc
Position calculation collection to use.
type
Default position calculation type.
flags
Flags for default position calculation.
Searches recursively through the selection tree for dynamic SEL_EXPRESSION elements that define the gmx_ana_selmethod_t::pupdate function. For each such element found, position calculation is initialized for the maximal evaluation group. The type of the calculation is determined by type and flags. No calculation is initialized if type equals POS_ATOM and the method also defines the gmx_ana_selmethod_t::update method.

briefdescription.para: Frees the allocated compiler data recursively.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Root of the selection subtree to process.
Frees the data allocated for the compilation process.

briefdescription.para: Selection compilation and optimization.

xrefdescription.para: Better error handling and memory management in error situations. At least, the main compilation function leaves the selection collection in a bad state if an error occurs.
The memory usage could still be optimized. Use of memory pooling could still be extended, and a lot of redundant gmin/gmax data could be eliminated for complex arithmetic expressions.
